info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 3:28AM EDT until July 14 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Florida, including the following county, St. Johns.
* WHEN...Until 630 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 328 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Saint Augustine, Saint Augustine Beach, Marineland, Vilano Beach, Saint Augustine South, Saint Augustine Shores, South Ponte Vedra, Butler Beach, Guana River State Park, Crescent Beach, Sawgrass, Palm Valley, Anastasia, South Ponte Vedra Beach and Dupont Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EDT THIS MORNING
